remarks: If ` F ` is a continuous function, then the limit of the function at any point equals its value.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)
statement:
cnlimci.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( A -cn-> D ) ) $.
cnlimci.c $e |- ( ph -> B e. A ) $.
cnlimci $p |- ( ph -> ( F ` B ) e. ( F limCC B ) ) $.
